componentDescription: Dialogs are overlaid modal paper based components with a backdrop.

propDescriptions.aria-describedby: The id(s) of the element(s) that describe the dialog.
propDescriptions.aria-labelledby: The id(s) of the element(s) that label the dialog.
propDescriptions.BackdropComponent: A backdrop component. This prop enables custom backdrop rendering.
propDescriptions.children: Dialog children, usually the included sub-components.
propDescriptions.classes: Override or extend the styles applied to the component. See CSS API below for more details.
propDescriptions.disableEscapeKeyDown: If true, hitting escape will not fire the onClose callback.
propDescriptions.fullWidth:
If true, the dialog stretches to maxWidth.
Notice that the dialog width grow is limited by the default margin.
propDescriptions.maxWidth: Determine the max-width of the dialog. The dialog width grows with the size of the screen. Set to false to disable maxWidth.
propDescriptions.onBackdropClick: Callback fired when the backdrop is clicked.
propDescriptions.onClose:
Callback fired when the component requests to be closed.

Signature:
function(event: object, reason: string) => void
event: The event source of the callback.
reason: Can be: "escapeKeyDown", "backdropClick".
propDescriptions.PaperComponent: The component used to render the body of the dialog.
propDescriptions.scroll: Determine the container for scrolling the dialog.
propDescriptions.sx: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles. See the `sx` page for more details.
propDescriptions.TransitionComponent: The component used for the transition. Follow this guide to learn more about the requirements for this component.
propDescriptions.transitionDuration: The duration for the transition, in milliseconds. You may specify a single timeout for all transitions, or individually with an object.
propDescriptions.TransitionProps: Props applied to the transition element. By default, the element is based on this Transition component.

root.description: Styles applied to the root element.
